intro: Dactylicapnos, commonly known as the bluebell or wild hyacinth, is a flowering plant belonging to the Boraginaceae family. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in woodland areas and has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are borne in clusters at the top of the stem, and it is known for its fragrant scent. Dactylicapnos is often found in moist, well-drained soils and is a common sight in temperate regions.
